h3. Summary:
This is happening when user tried to use project's "Mail Configuration" Email Address but it doesn't works as expected accordingly to JIRA documentation, [Configuring a Project's Email Address|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Configuring+Email+Notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-emailaddress].

I found out that the problem still persisting no matter configured via Host Name or JNDI Location with using GMail as Mail Server. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configure Outgoing Mail.
# Select the "Service Provider" to Gmail.
# Insert the Credentials of the Gmail Acount.
# Navigate to Project Admnistration > Summary
# Under the "Notifications" section, edit "Email" to change the sender address.
# Trigger the notification

h3. Expected Result:
The recipients will retrieve notification from the Project Configured Email Address

h3. Actual Result:
JIRA SMPT Server or Outgoing Mail is still the sender of the notification

fields.description:
I tried bumping UPM to support JIRA 4.4 from 4.3, and we got some failing tests with regards to the tests of the @RequiresRestart. Everything worked in JIRA 4.3, but there's something wrong in JIRA 4.4. Seems like the plugin returns a restart state of {{PluginRestartState.NONE}} instead of a {{PluginRestartState.INSTALL}}.

Note that this only happens when I'm installing a new plugin with a module that requires restart. But it works as expected when "upgrading" a plugin (i.e., @RequiresRestart is honored)
fields.summary: JIRA does not respect @RequiresRestart annotation

fields.description:
Some customers have complained that attaching large images on the issue via drag and drop and pressing the transition button in the same time puts the issue in a limbo state: it will be reported as partially advanced in the workflow.

Indeed, architecturally this is possible because both REST action and WorkflowTransitionUtil will receive a "detached" copy of the issue (they do not have knowledge of each other) so the update is not consistently executed.

An easy approach to this problem would be to disable the transition buttons (in fact, anything that might update the issue) while performing REST actions that are updating the issue; however this is not consistent and may put problems with the plugins (they should be aware too of this little trick). A consistent way would be to fix it at the API level (but this may require quite sensitive work).

Attached, the log on issue DDI-1784, showing that the user has attached quite a number of PDFs and JPGs (via D & D), while in the same time pressed the transition button.

The integrity checker naturally complains that:

........
Check workflow current step entries
   ERROR: 	DDI-1784 - The current step associated with the workflow entry with id 74133 has an incorrect stepId.
........


FYI, I searched the reported bugs, couldn't find anything close to it; hope it's not duplicate. If you need a test case let me know, I will do my best to provide such a test case to you. 

Have fun, R.
fields.summary: Incorrect update (using REST and transitioning the issue in the same time)

Hello,

searchrequest-xml allows to limit returned fields by listing them in URI
field=updated&field=components

Great feature. But not very convenient for use if we need to take all fields excluding Comments and Description.

We don't need those fields cause they eat too much traffic, but excluding them create enourmous GET request.

Would be nice to have opposite feature
excludefield=comment&excludefield=description - return all fields excluding Comments and Description.

Thx

Hello

We are using Jira 4.4.3
We highly rely on searchrequest-xml results to download data from Jira.
Having urlIcon and other type attributes returned in result make it's very inconvenient to pass the amount through network.

E.g.
<priority id="4" iconUrl="https://www.iajira.amers.ime.reuters.com/images/icons/priority_minor.gif">Minor</priority>. The data 'Minor' comparing to the iconUrl link value.
Another example is 
<customfield id="customfield_11261" key="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-global-rank">
  <customfieldname>Rank</customfieldname> 
  <customfieldvalues /> 
key value also looks meaningless in that case.

Would be great to have lighter xml result.

Hi Support

I have recently been assigned to import projects from JIRA 4.3 and JIRA 4.4.

Here is the story:

* JIRA 4.3 is connecting crowd service
* JIRA 4.4 is using internal user management for users' authentication. But we will use same crowd service for this JIRA instance before migrating projects. 
* I need to export all projects from JIRA 4.3, then import these projects into JIRA 4.4

My questions are:

* Do you have any special documentation for migrating projects from JIRA 4.3 into JIRA 4.4? Is it same process in this article? http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup

* As the users' account and groups are considered mandatory for importing projects. As both JIRA instances are connecting to CROWD (not configured at same time).So can users'account & groups from JIRA 4.3 still be found by JIRA 4.4 via CROWD?
 
** If no, is it possible to export DB (userbase) from JIRA 4.3 (or from CROWD?), importing into JIRA 4.4 (or into same CROWD?) with remaining same users' password?
** Do you have any other way to make this work?

Thanks. 

Regards

Sjedi

  {panel}

For example:

* atlassian-mail-1.24 -> 1.25: Changes the return type of MailServer.getSession from alt.javax.mail.Session to javax.mail.Session
* atlassian-mail-1.24 -> 1.25: Removes the dependency on mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar. Unfortunately, we are exporting the classes from this JAR to Plugin v2 plugins through the DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration.
* ...

I am not sure if these changes will even cause any plugins to stop working, but there is a chance.

If we decide not be binary compatible then we will need to cleanup DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration to stop a "Unable to find any resources for package 'alt/javax'" that appears during startup. If we decide to be binary compatible then we will need to ship the JAR again.

fields.description:
There appear to be numerous installation/permission problems on RHEL6.1 x86_64.
While attempting to install using 'atlassian-jira-5.0-beta3-x64.bin' first the 'useradd' call silently fails. Fixing the useradd problem then leads to start up problems with ownership.  The following items are what I found before giving up.

When attempting to run setup_user.sh the useradd silently fails:
+ useradd jira -c 'Atlassian JIRA' -K UMASK=0077
useradd: cannot create directory /home/jira

I modified line 100 of setup_user.sh as follows:
100c100
Original < useradd "$username" -c "Atlassian JIRA" -K UMASK=0077
—
Modified > useradd "$username" -c "Atlassian JIRA" -K UMASK=0077 -d "$jira_home"

setup_user.sh runs chmod +x "$install_dir"/bin/*.sh but does not set proper ownership of files in "$install_dir/bin"

In certain conditions we often want to do data restoration whteher to restore full data, import a project or rename project key. In all of these operations, a simple corruption in the XML file will result in errors requring that we either edit the xml file ourselves to fix it or fix the problem from the source instance and take a fresh backup. 

A simple scenario is when an external entity (say users from crowd) have null usernames. This will result in an error message as shown in the screenshot below.

!screenshot-1.jpg!

It will be nice that either the JIRA component that generates the XML backup only writes what is needed, or the component that reads in the XML is fixed so that it understands whatever the generator writes.

fields.description:
The easiest way to test:

# Create and Oracle user "JIRA2". Note this user cannot be JIRA because of another bug (JRA-26189). Ensure this user has CREATE TABLE, UNLIMITED TABLESPACE,CREATE SEQUENCE, CREATE SESSION, CREATE SYNONYM, CREATE TABLE, CREATE TRIGGER, CREATE VIEW.
# Connect JIRA to Oracle as this user. We do this to get JIRA to create all its tables.
# Install the jira-func-test plugin. 
# Run {{curl -u <username>:<password> -X POST --data '\{"text":"text", "author":"author"\}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" <root>/rest/func-test/latest/blog}}. This will add an AO object to the database and create any tables.
# Run {{curl -u <username>:<password> <root>/rest/func-test/latest/blog}} to see if the data is there.
# Stop JIRA.
# Create an Oracle user called "safeuser" with DELETE ANY TABLE, INSERT ANY TABLE, SELECT ANY SEQUENCE, SELECT ANY TABLE, UNLIMITED TABLESPACE, UPDATE ANY TABLE
# Configure {{dbconfig.xml}} with username = safeuser, password = <password> and schema-name = JIRA2 (capitals a must). 
# Start JIRA.
# Run {{curl -u <username>:<password> <root>/rest/func-test/latest/blog}}. Should return the item you created above. If it returns a 500 error, then the problem still exists.

REF: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AO-204

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary Can't use StAX from inside a plugins 2 plugin without embedded woodstox in the plugin. h3. Steps to Reproduce From a v2 plugin call this: {code} XMLInputFactory factory = XMLInputFactory.newFactory(); factory.createXMLEventReader(new StringReader("")); {code} h3. Expected Results The call is successful h3. Actual Results You end up with: {noformat} javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder$ConfigurationError: Provider com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxInputFactory not found at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.newInstance(FactoryFinder.java:154) at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.findJarServiceProvider(FactoryFinder.java:308) at javax.xml.stream.FactoryFinder.find(FactoryFinder.java:233) at javax.xml.stream.XMLInputFactory.newFactory(XMLInputFactory.java:156) at com.atlassian.jira.dev.functest.ao.BlogResource.getAll(BlogResource.java:91) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:206) at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:90) {noformat} h3. Notes * JIRA ships with wstx-asl-3.2.4.jar (Woodstox) in {{WEB-INF/lib}}. This JAR registers itself with the JVM to provide implementations of XMLInputFactory, XMLOutputFactory and XMLEventFactory from its {{META-INF.services}}. Basically, once we put this JAR in {{WEB-INF/lib}} we end up with com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxInputFactory, com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxOutputFactory and com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxEventFactory being the default implementations of these classes. * The problem is that we don't expose the wstx-asl-3.2.4.jar classes to plugins even though we expose its {{META-INF.services}} (we boot delegate META-INF.services)). * The solution *is NOT* to simply add the wstx-asl to the packages that we expose to plugins (what happens we change the JAR and replace with a different implementation?). h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't use StAX from inside a plugins 2 plugin without embedded woodstox in the plugin.

fields.description:
On some OSes, the user created by JIRA's installer has the shell {{/bin/false}}. This causes {{start-jira.sh}} to fail if it can't inherit {{$SHELL}}.

STR:

# Install JIRA 4.4 on an Ubuntu box.
# Reboot, or shut down JIRA.
# Use {{sudo service jira start}} to attempt to start JIRA.

Expected outcome: JIRA starts.

Actual outcome: output from the JIRA init script stops after
{noformat}
To run JIRA in the foreground, start the server with start-jira.sh -fg

Server startup logs are located in /opt/atlassian/jira/bin/logs/catalina.out
executing using dedicated user: jira
{noformat}
and JIRA does not start.

Root cause:

{{start-jira.sh}} contains the following stanza:

{code:language=bash}
    if [ -x "/sbin/runuser" ]; then
        sucmd="/sbin/runuser"
    else
        sucmd="su"
    fi

    if [ "$PRGRUNMODE" == "true" ] ; then
        $sucmd -m $JIRA_USER -c "$PRGDIR/catalina.sh run $@"
    else
        $sucmd -m $JIRA_USER -c "$PRGDIR/startup.sh $@"
    fi
{code}

Unfortunately, the {{service}} wrapper on some OSes (including Ubuntu) clears the {{SHELL}} environment variable, causing {{su}} to look up the shell in {{/etc/passwd}} -- where it's {{/bin/false}}. {{startup.sh}} never runs.

Workaround:

Manually start JIRA each boot using {{/etc/init.d/jira start}} (not {{service jira start}}).
fields.summary: start-jira.sh doesn't set the shell for su(1)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26208].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is currently no method to prevent sub-task creation on a specific workflow status.

The following Workflow Properties have no effect on users being able to create sub-tasks.
* {{jira.permission.create}}
* {{jira.permission.subtasks.create}}

Administrators are unable prevent users from creating Sub-tasks with this current bug. When viewing an issue in the state where that permission _should_ be locked down, there is still an option for creating a sub-task.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
JIRA 6.3 was used to replicate this issue:

# Open the Workflow Editor ("Administration -> Projects -> <SELECTED-PROJECT> -> Workflow -> Edit)
# Add the following Workflow Properties to one of the steps: 
* {{jira.permission.create}} and set to {{denied}}
* {{jira.permission.subtasks.create}} and set to {{denied}}
# Publish the edited workflow
# Create a new issue for <SELECTED-PROJECT> and transition to the edited Step (Issue Status).
# Attempt to create a new "Sub-task" for the issue. Observe that the user is able to do so.
# Observe that this "Sub-Task" is created and linked to the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The workflow property should have prevented the Sub-Task from being created.

h3. Actual Results
The workflow property had no effect on the User's ability to create a new Sub-Task.

h3. Notes
* Attached Screenshots for all windows showing the settings applied when demonstrating this issue. (JIRA 4.4)
* Specifically: One of the permissions is the Create permission, which was denied to everyone.
* When viewing an issue in the state where that permission should be locked down, there is still the option for creating a sub-task.
* User was able to click on "Create Sub-Task" and create a sub-task which looks fine and shows that it is a sub-task of the parent issue.  However, when you go back to the parent issue, you do not see any sub-tasks for that issue. (JIRA 4.4)
* The last part of the parent not knowing of it's sub-tasks is not very important because the first part of a sub-task still being able to be created shouldn't even be available or allowed based on the permissions that i set in the state of the workflow. (JIRA 4.4)
* [JRA-10077|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10077] - Mentions a suggestion to refactor some of the permissions relating sub-task creation.

h3. Workaround
In some circumstances users can prevent all edits to an issue at a specific workflow status:
# Edit the project Workflow, as per: [Configuring Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Configuring+Workflow]
# Click "View Properties" for the targeted step.
# Add a new property {{jira.issue.editable}} with value {{false}} (as per [Workflow properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Workflow+properties])
# Publish the edited workflow.

This will prevent *all* edits being made to an issue when at the defined state. The workaround can be used to prevent the user from creating sub-tasks on closed or resolved issues.
fields.summary: Subtasks can be created even when create permission is removed via Workflow state Properties

This keeps me from setting correct permissions for my workflow steps.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26205].
  {panel}

h3. Description
When user opened exported filter to xls file. The exported xls file will open on blank sheet on Libre Office Calc 3.4.x. There's a possibility that this issue is related to Libre Office instead of JIRA, since it can be opened using Libre office 3.3.x.

h3. Findings
# When the attached file is opened using text editor, you will see all the content inside. 
# Ran xml validator against the attached file. Here's all the error returned.
{noformat}
29:20 The reference to entity "R" must end with the ';' delimiter.
58:3 The element type "META" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</META>".
66:11 The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>".
199:15 The element type "tbody" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</tbody>".
{noformat}


h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Search or select any filter in JIRA.
# Click *View > Excel* and it will generate xls file.
# Open the file using Libre Office Calc 3.4.x.
# Blank sheet will be displayed even though the file has content inside.

h3. Workaround
Open the generated file in Libre Office Calc 3.3.x.
fields.summary: Export filter to excel won't work with Libre Office 3.4.x.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26204].
  {panel}

We got complains from users because they feel they are missing some important notifications. 

Our current notification schemes don't inform watchers about Issue Assigned, Issue Updated and Issue Edited, but watchers expect to get all comments.

However JIRA doesn't fire Issue Commented, when the comment is added through  an edit issue or through another screen. The only way to fire the event seems to be using Comment buttons.

The expected  behavior is firing the Issue Commented event whenever a new comment is added into jiraaction.
fields.summary: Issue Commented event is not fired when a comment is added through a screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26202].
  {panel}

These are the steps to prodocue the error:

# Create a customfield (any field). As an example: User name
# Create a search filter containing that customfield (Ex: Project = "Test" AND User name = "user01"
# Save that filter.
# Rename the customfield. Ex. From User name to Username
# Access the previous filter and the filter will not show any result.

To prevent this, you can change the JQL query from User name to the custom field ID (IE cf[10010]).  However, it is not user-friendly for customers who are preferably using the simple search.  

It would be convenient for all the users if the simple search feature on the Issue Navigator uses the custom-field ID from the beginning rather than the custom-field name. It would definitely make changes to the custom-field's name more adaptable.
fields.summary: Changes in Custom Field Name causes failure of saved Filters
Table sent via mail to add as comment is corrupted

fields.description:
We have a set of monitoring tools that ping the JIRA URLs to access the application's health status, although for some classes of errors when a Johnson (/errors.jsp) page is displayed presenting the errors to the user the actual status code returned is HTTP 200, when the expected would be 503 as the service is currently unavailable for the user.
We can use the 'Retry-After' HTTP header to indicate the browser that this is a temporary error and it should retry after a few seconds, this would be the case when a backup is being restored, but in cases when have a JIRA startup problem due to plugin failures for example, it would also indicate a 503, and then we would be able to automatic assess that something is wrong with the instance.

See attached patch.
fields.summary: errors.jsp should return HTTP 503 (Service Unavailable) when there are Johnson Events that prevent the user from accesing the application

How3ever, during our POC activity, we encountered issues when trying to display several filters on the dashboards.
Most of these filters happen to have the account's username as a filter.

PLease note that the users in the LDAP Directory we are integrating already exists in the JIRA internal Directory
fields.summary: Search Filters are not displaying any results when an NEW  LDAP Directory is prioritized against the default JIRA Directory for LDAP integration purposes

fields.description:
The JIRA RPC plugin exports several <component>s. When this plugin was converted from a v1 to v2 plugin, an OSGi export was not added for the necessary classes.

This means that it is imposible to have (for example) SoapUtilsBean constructor-injected into another plugin.

*Desired* All <component>s (and hence all classes and dependant classes) in the RPC plugin should be constructor-injectable and usable in another v2 plugin.
fields.summary: SoapUtilsBean is a <component> in the JIRA RPC plugin, but the class is not exported into OSGi.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Set up JIRA, create issue TST-1
* Run the following command twice:, making sure to use the wrong password:

{noformat}curl -i -u admin:notadminpassword http://localhost:8080/browse/TST-1{noformat}

You should get a 401 Unauthorized HTTP status code and {{X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATED_FAILED}} in the response headers.

* Run the command again. You will get {{X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATION_DENIED}} in the response, meaning that the 2 failed logins have triggered CAPTCHA protection, even though 3 failed logins are required to trigger CAPTCHA protection (!).

Looks like Seraph's {{PasswordBasedLoginFilter}} and {{DefaultAuthenticator}} are stepping on each other's toes here. Why are they both responsible for calling {{ElevatedSecurityGuard.onFailedLoginAttempt(HttpServletRequest,String)}}?
fields.summary: Failed authentication in BASIC auth requests causes CAPTCHA counter to be incremented twice
Saved filters with names like '&' can't be searched for

fields.description:
This issue directly relates to JRA-24558, which has been marked fixed for JIRA 4.4.3.

After some testing with the new release, I found that filters and dashboards are still not recognized.  Issues, however, have been fixed.

*Reproduce*
* Create a user with username "testuser"
* Login with username "testuser"
* Create a new issue filter and a new personal dashboard
* Inside the LDAP directory, create a username "TestUser"
* Move the LDAP directory to the top
* Going back to the dashboard as "TestUser" results in using the default system dashboard
* Going to 'Manage Filters' does not show the newly created filter.

I also created a new personal dashboard for "TestUser".  In the database under the *{{portalpage}}* table, you can see that both "testuser" and "TestUser" is listed for their own personal dashboards.

In the previous report (JRA-24558), this was also mentioned:
bq. This error happens because JIRA is using the column *user_name* in the table *cwd_user* for all operations. JIRA should have used the column *lower_user_name*. For example, the table *jiraissue* is showing "Administrator" in the column *reporter* for ticket B.

I did some SQL logging and found that JIRA still uses *{{user_name}}* for references.
fields.summary: Mixed case username from LDAP still has a few problems

  {panel}

When converting to a Sub-Task in Jira, it doesn't let you type in the issue number in lowercase. All other places will automatically convert it to uppercase for you, so this one trips me up.

Steps:
1.	More Actions > Convert to subtask
2.	Type in the parent issue in lowercase
3.	Next
Expected: Issue is converted to uppercase and it finds it
Actual: Issue is not converted to uppercase so you have to retype it in uppercase
fields.summary: Convert to subtask - Allow the user to enter the issue in lowercase

fields.description:
*NOTE*: This problem will not occur if you follow JIRA's recommended Oracle configuration to leave the "schema-name" blank. In this case JIRA will use the DB user's own schema. 

# Connect to Oracle as "jira". All the DB tables should be created.
# Stop JIRA.
# Edit "dbconfig.xml" and set "schema-name" to "JIRA" (the uppercase is important and correct).
# (BUG) Start JIRA. You will get:

{noformat}
2011-11-08 21:24:18,957 main WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Action" has no table in the database
2011-11-08 21:24:18,987 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "JIRA.jiraaction"
2011-11-08 21:24:18,987 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE JIRA.jiraaction (ID NUMBER(18,0) NOT NULL, issueid NUMBER(18,0), AUTHOR VARCHAR2(255), actiontype VARCHAR2(255), actionlevel VARCHAR2(255), rolelevel NUMBER(18,0), actionbody CLOB, CREATED DATE, UPDATEAUTHOR VARCHAR2(255), UPDATED DATE, actionnum NUMBER(18,0), CONSTRAINT PK_jiraaction PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00955: name is already used by an existing object
{noformat}

Note that this is only for tables that start with the schema-name "JIRA".

You can also get a similar error if you try an connect to the "JIRA" schema as a different user. For example, lets say that "safeuser" has permission to all the tables in the "JIRA" schema. Now lets say that JIRA is configured to connect to Oracle as "safeuser" but has the schema-name set to "JIRA". JIRA will attempt to create any tables that start with "JIRA" as "safeuser" in the "JIRA" schema which the user probably wont have permission to do. In this case you end up with:

{noformat}
2011-11-08 21:32:38,658 main WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "ChangeGroup" has no table in the database
2011-11-08 21:32:38,662 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "JIRA.changegroup"
2011-11-08 21:32:38,663 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE JIRA.changegroup (ID NUMBER(18,0) NOT NULL, issueid NUMBER(18,0), AUTHOR VARCHAR2(255), CREATED DATE, CONSTRAINT PK_changegroup PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01031: insufficient privileges
{noformat}
fields.summary: Can't specify a explicit Oracle schema in the  dbconfig.xml that is also a prefix of a JIRA table name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26175].
  {panel}

    Jira uses binary ordering for the project name instead of using better alphabetical order even if the database is set otherwise. For example in Oracle we set our database so that NLS_SORT is French. This causes the database to not make the difference between accentuated letters and non accentuated ones. This means that an "É" is like an "E".

    This means that if you have the following project names : "Assurance", "Cadre de gestion", "Engagement", "Évaluation" and "Suivi des dossiers", the order written before is the good one. But Jira will write "Évaluation" as the last one. Since we have around 30 projects it's annoying that the "Évaluation" project does not appear where it belongs in the alphabetical order.

    This happens in all the place where projects are listed, i.e. the create issues screen, the project list page, in the project gadget, etc.

    Jira should rely on the order set by the database or have a parameter to set the way Jira works.


    I've contacted customer support, who told me to open an improvement request. If you want to see the support ticket it's JSP-95853.

    I also included a screenshot that shows the top and the bottom of the project list. You will see the "Évaluation financière des conditions de travail" project at the end of the list instead of before the "Formulaire d'admissibilité 44/48" project.
fields.summary: Project order should not be binary

fields.description:
As known, after the version 4.2, the plugin "Labels" has been incorporated in JIRA's structure. It has caused some inconsistencies between the way in which a label custom field behaved before and how it works now.

The main issue here is:

*JIRA 4.1.1:*
- If a custom field type label is empty, it's still displayed on the issue view screen.

*JIRA 4.4.1:*
- If a custom field type label is empty, it's not displayed on the issue view screen - as the other custom fields behaves.

Basically, it's not outlined anywhere and tends to don't be an expected behavior:

!label_4_1_1.png!
_Field displayed even with no data._
!label_4_4_1_ss1.png!
_With an option, it works fine._
!label_4_4_1_ss2.png!
_Otherwise, it's hidden._
fields.summary: Custom field type 'Label' does not behave correctly after JIRA 4.2

fields.description:
vCalling Jira's create issue routine from any transition locks the database. 
The workflow advances an issue in the workflow and on the executed transition it creates another issue by calling Jira's own create issue code.

The attached test case locks Jira each time.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Install the bic plugin (it's a type 2 plugin) - Please see the README.txt found in the sources archive
2. Create a workflow scheme "WF-SCHEME-STRESS-TEST" (*)
3. Create transition "Create other issue" and set the issue creation postfunction on this transition (*)
4. Start JMeter and load the stress test project.
5. Execute it.

(*) You can easily import in a JIRA instance the xml dump we used for test (jira_4.3.4_lock_problem.zip).

Output with the problem:
(SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE project SET pcounter=? WHERE ID=? (Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction))
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleUpdate(GenericDAO.java:253)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleStore(GenericDAO.java:300)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.storeAll(GenericDAO.java:318)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.storeAll(GenericHelperDAO.java:221)
................................


Related to: support issues: JSP-93481 and JSP-93314

Note 1: Our temporary workaround was to create the issue on another thread. However, I cannot wait for that thread to finish in the original post-function because I will run into the same problem. On the other hand, I also cannot always create the issue independently because I will need its id in the 'originating' issue for further processing.
Note 2: Please do not say it's our fault (unless we have made a HUGE mistake :) ). To preserve consistency, I must use your API, so I'm kinda constrained to it (I do not want to go directly on the database). Please notify us if you think your API is not used correctly.
Note 3: IMHO, the update "UPDATE project SET pcounter=? WHERE ID=?" can be avoided. This will boost a bit the performance at issue creation. Use the reservation technique, similar with what Oracle does on sequences. In this matter, you are already greatly helped by the fact that you cannot cluster Jira (but a similar solution should be used when you finally decide to make it cluster aware).
fields.summary: Creating an issue from a transition can lock the database under load.

  {panel}

We are using JIRA in our company for some weeks and now, we would like to add our customers to JIRA. 
For this, we created a custom field named 'customer' (select list) which contains our custumers as items. 
Due to our customers data are maintenanced in another system, we created an import mechanism for our customers to JIRA. 
As first step, we created a JIRA plugin with custom filters, which workes fine. (The plugin just contains the atlassian-plugin.xml with system.preset.filters) 
Our problem is now, that we need to add the items for our custom field 'customer' by the plugin. 
Alternativly, we could create a custom field of the type 'select list' with our customers as items within the plugin.
We searched for this in the 'JIRA Plugin Guide' but couldn't find an plugin module which gives this possibility. 
(We found the 'Custom Field Plugin Module' and found there, how to create a new type of custom field, but not, how to create a custom field using an already existing type.) 
Please, could you give us a reference to how to resolve this?
fields.summary: Creating a custom field within a plugin using the 'select list'-type

Looking at my profile on EACJ, JIRA tells me that my time zone is:

Time Zone:(GMT+10:00) Sydney

This is quite confusing to me, as Sydney's local time zone is currently GMT+11. I can't tell if this means "GMT+10, which is what Sydney is usually on" or "Sydney time, which is usually GMT+10"

I'd like my times to always display in my current local time; so depending on which interpretation is correct, I either need to manually change this to "GMT+11" while DST is in effect; or leave it alone and let JIRA work its magic.
fields.summary: JIRA is ambiguous when describing timezones

  {panel}

When a user directory is deleted, the users are still in the database. Customer wishes to also have the users removed. His argument is as follow:
"
If you create a directory and then remove the directory, what need is there to keep information around as you do?
Yes is a problem to have this data around after you have deleted the directory.
As there is a bug in change a directory setting and one way to resolve that bug is to recreate the directory and remove the old one. And if you choose this strategy then you will end up with a alot of old data in the db that is never used. We have 45.000+ user and 35.000+ groups, make the above operation a couple of time and you will start to have performance issues.

We view this a bug or a mandatory improvement that you need to fix.
"
fields.summary: Remove users at the same time as their parent user diretory is removed

fields.description:
User wants the option to roll back to a JIRA version even though the database version has become incompatible. User suggests that Jira should propose to restore an xml backup even if it has to reset completly the whole database. Case scenario example. Roll back from Jira 4.1.2 to 4.1.1 . User does not accept workaround of installing a 2d separate instance of JIRA to rollback. 
The user argument is as follow:
"
Imagine that you find a big regression (bug) in a new version of Jira.
You want to go back to the previous version of Jira and wait for the next release.
But if your database has been upgraded, it is impossible to go back. Even if you have an old backup.
My request is not very strange : just to be able to restore a xml backup if jira detects incompatible version between version of jira and version of datas in database rather, than falling in this dead end.
"
fields.summary: Impossible to restore a xml backup after upgrading Jira

fields.description:
h3.The Error

This error has been reproduce with a clean JIRA 4.4.3 instance. When you change the language to "Portuguese BR", it's possible to see this translation error in the issue navigator:

!br_translation_error.png!

h3.Workaround

# Shut down your JIRA instance.
# Go to _<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib_ and open the file *jira-lang-pt_BR-4.4.3.jar* with an archive manager tool as 7zip.
# Inside this file, you will see two folders. Roll to _/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/_ and open the file *JiraWebActionSupport_pt_BR.properties* with a text editor tool.
# Search for the line *navigator.desc1 =* and you will see the text "O Navegador de Pend\u00eancias permite que voc\u00ea navegaue em todas as pend\u00eancias do sistema.".
# Replace *navegaue* with *navegue*, save any change and update the file *jira-lang-pt_BR-4.4.3.jar*.
# Finally, start your instance again and check if the issue is gone.
fields.summary: JIRA translation error in Issue Navigator - Language PT-BR
